715667f-a.text:
West 151st Street, west from Seventh, to and including Eighth Aves. Note station of the Ninth Ave., Elevated on Eighth Ave.
August 29, 1935.
P. L Sperr.

710040f-b.text:
(1)
The new United States Government Housing development on Seventh Ave. (right) north from West 151st (foreground) to 153rd Streets, and west to Macombs Place (left). North of this development and south of the Central Bridge (West 155th Street), appears Harlem Lane Park; a small triangular plot at the convergance of Seventh Ave., and Macombs
Place at West 155th Street.
September 19, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A more extensive view northward. Note the serpentine course of the Harlem River. Crossing same, in the order of their appearance, are the Central (West 155th Street) Bridge, the New York and Putman R.R. Bridge (about West 158th Street) and High Bridge (about West 174th
Street).
September 19, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
A view north west and showing prominently the Macombs Place side. Shown on the extreme left, are buildings at the N.W. corner of West
152nd Street.
September 19, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

710043f-b.text:
(1)
Seventh Ave., north from about West 151st Street, to the Central Bridge (155th Street), which crosses the Harlem River to the Borough of Bronx. Shown on both sides of Seventh Ave., is work in progress for a U.S. Government Slum clearance and low cost housing development, under
the auspices of the W.P.A. and P.W.A.
September 19, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
Another view slightly northward.
September 19, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

710043f-a.text:

(2)

September 19, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

710046f-a.text:
Seventh Ave. (foreground), east side, south from West 152nd to West 151st Streets, showing car yards of the Interborough Rapid Transit Co. Also shown is a general view in a southeasterly direction with the Harlem River and the western shore of the Bronx across it, appearing on the left. Note also the Central Wridge across the Harlem River.
September 19, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

710041f.text:
Seventh Avenue, from W. 15lst to 153rd Streets, showing details of the Harlem slum clearance project "Rivertiew Houses."
Summer 1938
Alexander Alland

710042f-a.text:
Seventh Avenue, from W. 151st to 153rd Streets, showing details of the Harlem slum clearance project "Riverview Houses."
1238
Alexander Alland
This photo is one of a series that appeared in the published volume "Portrait of N. Y." by Felix Reisenberg and Alex. Alland, IRGV.

710044f.text:
Seventh Avenue, from WW. 15lst to 153rd Streets, showing details of the Harlem slum clearance project "Riverview Houses."
Summer 1938
Alexander Alland
Ne. ~21t
